c74object.name: dada.bodies
c74object.description: Implements a simplified model of a universe with steady stars being played by the passage of planets.

outlet.description: Sends the hit data (planet, body, note) for any played note, if hitdata attribute is on.
Outlet dedicated to send out playout data

outlet.digest: bang when something is changed via the interface

method.name: (drag)
method.digest: Load file or set background image
method.description: Dragging an llll or text file on the object will load its content, if a proper readable format is recognized. If the file is an image, it will be loaded as object background (whenever meaningful)

method.name: (keyboard)
method.description:
• Esc: reset center to (0, 0) and zoom to 100%
• Tab: autozoom
• Cmd+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Z (win): perform undo step
• Cmd+Shift+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Y (win): perform redo step
• Spacebar: toggle play
• Tab: autozoom

method.name: (mouse)
method.description:
• mousewheel scroll: move the visible region
• Cmd+mousewheel scroll (mac) or Ctrl+mousewheel scroll (win): change zoom
• right-click or two-fingers tap: open contextual menu for basic operations
• click+drag on an element ot move it
↪ Add the Alt key to duplicate it
• Cmd+click (mac) or Ctrl+click (win) on an element to delete it
• Cmd+click (mac) or Ctrl+click (win) on the background to add a star
• Alt+Cmd+click (mac) or Alt+Ctrl+click (win) on the background to add a planet
• Shift+click on a star to add a note
• right click or two fingers tap: open contextual menu

method.name: (tools)
method.description:
Tools are combination of a specific key pressed and some mouse action. Whenever you press the key, if the tool is available, the mouse cursor will switch to the tool specific one.
Available tools are:
• Keep the Z key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to change the zoom
• Keep the X key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to move the displayed center
• Keep the N key pressed, click on the desired element and drag up or down in order to modify its pitch.
• Keep the S key pressed, click on the desired element and drag up or down in order to scale its magnitude or value.
• Keep the R key pressed, click on the desired element and drag up or down in order to rotate it.
• Keep the Q key pressed, click on an element, drag up or down to modify the color hue or saturation.

method.name: addplanets
method.description: Add test particles to the universe. The addplanets word must be followed by an llll in the form PLANET1 PLANET2..., each in the syntax explained in the dump message.

method.name: addstars
method.description: Add stars to the universe. The addstars word must be followed by an llll in the form STAR1 STAR2..., each in the syntax explained in the dump message.

method.name: autozoom
method.description: Adapts view and zoom automatically according to the current stars' and planets' positions.

method.name: clear
method.description: Deletes all bodies and particles

method.name: clock
method.description: The word clock, followed by the name of an existing setclock objects, sets the dada.bounce object to be controlled by that setclock object rather than by Max's internal millisecond clock. The word clock by itself sets the object back to using Max's regular millisecond clock.

method.name: deleteplanet
method.description: The word deleteplanet followed by an integer N deletes the N-th planet from the world.

method.name: deletestar
method.description: The word deletestar followed by an integer N deletes the N-th star from the world.

method.name: distribute
method.description: The word distribute, followed by an integer N, distributes evenly the angles of the notes belonging to the N-th star. Add a mirror symbol as second argument in order to also add mirrored notes in a forward-backward configuration.

method.name: domain
method.description: The domain message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the X axis. The domain message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the left boundary or at the right boundary of the object box.

method.name: dump
method.description:
Outputs the current state of the object. The syntax is bodies [stars STAR1 STAR2...] [planets PLANET1 PLANET2...]. Each star is in the syntax (coord x y) (density d) (radius r) (notes NOTE1 NOTE2...) (color r g b a) (channel MIDIchannel) (flags flags), where each NOTE is in the syntax [angle MIDIcents].
Each particle is in the syntax (coord x y) (speed x y) (acc x y) (color r g b a) (channel MIDIchannel) (flags flags).
Item flags syntax in dada is the following one [flags flag1 flag2...], where each flag is one of the following symbols: lock, mute, solo, inactive.

method.name: exportimage
follow
method.description: Start following one or more planets. Following a single planet means that the particle will always be kept in a "subjective view" at the center of the displayed region. If more than one planet is followed, their barycenter is kept at the center of the displayed region, and the zoom is also adapted in case they end up being outside the displayed region. Use follow all to follow all planets. Use follow without any argument to stop following planets.

method.name: forceperiod
method.digest: Force the period of a planet
method.description: The symbol forceperiod followed by an integer N and a floating point number P forces the N-th planet to have circular motion of period P (in milliseconds) with respect to its nearest star. Notice that this only applies to the ideal situation where that single star exists; if other stars come into play, the motion will in generall not be circular, but rather will be affected by the other stars' presence. Also, differently from forcecircular this message only works properly when the gravitational law is the default standard one, and it doesn't work for a custom law.

method.name: forceperiod
method.digest: Force a planet to have circular motion
method.description: The symbol forcecircular followed by an integer N forces the N-th planet to have circular motion with respect to its nearest star. Notice that this only applies to the ideal situation where that single star exists; if other starsst come into play, the motion will in generall not be circular, but rather will be affected by the other stars' presence. If an additional "zero" symbol is set as second argument, the position and velocity of the planet are "zeroed" by putting the planet right above the star, with a rightward pointing horizontal velocity.

method.name: getdomain
method.description: The getdomain message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the X axis, preceded by a domain symbol.

method.name: getrange
method.description: The getrange message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the Y axis, preceded by a range symbol.

method.name: llll
method.description: Sets the current state of the object. The syntax must follow the one described in the dump message documentation (although stars only or planets only can be assigned).

method.name: planet
method.description: Modifies the state of one of the planet. The planet word must be followed by the index of the planet to be modified, and the new PLANET llll, in the syntax explained in the dump message. Not all the specifications need to be assigned; the unassigned attributes will be kept as they are.

method.name: play
method.description: Starts the sequencing engine.

method.name: range
method.description: The range message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the Y axis The range message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the bottom boundary or at top right boundary of the object box.

method.name: read
method.description: The specified file is read from disk and the llll it contains loaded as current state. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: restart
method.description: Sets the current time to 0.

method.name: settime
method.description: Sets the current time to a given value, in milliseconds.

method.name: star
method.description: Modifies the state of one of the star. The star word must be followed by the index of the star to be modified, and the new STAR llll, in the syntax explained in the dump message. Not all the specifications need to be assigned; the unassigned attributes will be kept as they are.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops the sequencing engine.

method.name: write
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in native format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: writetxt
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in a human-readable text format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

attribute.name: allowcentershift
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to allow the center to shift.

attribute.name: allowzoom
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to allow zooming

attribute.name: approxmethod
attribute.description: Sets the integration algorithm (approximation method). The choice is between Euler, Leapfrog and Runge-Kutta 4.

attribute.name: axescolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the x and y axes.

attribute.name: axeslabelscolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the x and y axes labels.

attribute.name: axeslabelsfontsize
attribute.description: Sets the size of the axes labels font.

attribute.name: bgcolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the background.

attribute.name: bgimage
attribute.description: Sets a background image texture, tiling the plane. Use "" or "none" to remove the image.

attribute.name: bordercolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the border.

attribute.name: center
attribute.description: Sets the coordinate of the center

attribute.name: embed
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to embed the state of the object within the patcher.

attribute.name: g
attribute.description: Sets the value for the G constant

attribute.name: gridcolor
attribute.description: Sets the grid color.

attribute.name: gridlabelscolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the grid labels.

attribute.name: gridlabelsfontsize
attribute.description: Sets the size of the grid labels font.

attribute.name: gridmode
attribute.description: Sets the grid mode, either Fixed (0) or Automatic (1 = default). In Automatic mode the space between grid lines is automatically adapted according to the level of zoom.

attribute.name: gridstep
attribute.description: Sets the grid size, in coordinates (only useful if gridmode is set to 0 = Fixed)

attribute.name: hidewhileplaying
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to prevent the object from painting and displaying bodies and particles during playback. This can be useful if one needs to save CPU time.

attribute.name: highlightplay
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to highlight the played notes.

attribute.name: hitdata
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to also output hit data for every played note from third outlet. The data includes indices of planets, stars, notes involved in the hit, along with the note midicents.

attribute.name: indexaschannel
attribute.description: If active, the output MIDI channel is NOT the ball or body midichannel, rather their index.

attribute.name: law
attribute.description: s Sets a custom gravitational law. Usable variables and parameters are: "G" (gravitational constant), "m" (body mass), "r" (body radius), "d" (distance from body). The default newtonian law is equivalent to setting law -G*m/(d*d).

attribute.name: maxundosteps
attribute.description: Sets the maximum number of undo steps (0 being: no undo).

attribute.name: mousehover
attribute.description: Toggles mouse hovering capabilities.

attribute.name: notifypaint
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to notify every new redraw of the box via a "painted" symbol.

attribute.name: showacceleration
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to display the particle acceleration vector (and possibly its numeric component also).

attribute.name: showaxes
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the x and y axes.

attribute.name: showaxeslabels
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the x and y axes labels.

attribute.name: showborder
attribute.description: Sets the color of the border.

attribute.name: showdensity
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to display the density of each body.

attribute.name: showfocus
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to draw a thicker border when the object has the focus.

attribute.name: showgrid
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the grid.

attribute.name: showgridlabels
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the grid labels.

attribute.name: shownotes
showplanetid
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to display the ID next to each planet.

attribute.name: showspeed
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to display the particle speed vector (and possibly its numeric component also).

attribute.name: showstarid
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to display the ID next to each star.

attribute.name: snaptogrid
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to snap items to the grid.

attribute.name: usemidichannels
attribute.description: s Sets the midichannels that will be used at playtime: either the stars' ones (0, default) or the planets' ones (1).

attribute.name: velslope
attribute.description: Sets a slope (-1 to 1, 0 being linear) for the velocity mapping (from zeroveldist to maxveldist).

attribute.name: verboseundo
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to post undo/redo steps in the Max window.

attribute.name: xlabel
attribute.description: Sets the label for the x axis.

attribute.name: ylabel
attribute.description: Sets the label for the y axis.

attribute.name: zeroveldist
attribute.description: Sets the distance which will be associated to zero-velocity notes. Planets moving farther than this distance, with respect to a given star, will not trigger any of the star's notes.

entry.name: Outlet 3 (llll)
entry.description: Hit data. Sends the hit data (planet, body, note) for any played note, if hitdata attribute is on.

entry.name: Outlet 4 (llll)
entry.description: Playout. Outlet dedicated to send out playout data

entry.name: Outlet 5 (bang)
entry.description: bang when something is changed via the interface.
